questions.text: Which type of computer is designed to provide services and resources to other computers on a network?
questions.explanation: A server is designed to provide services, resources, and data to other computers on a network.

questions.text: Which of the following devices is NOT considered a mobile device?
questions.explanation: Desktops are stationary devices, while smartphones, tablets, and e-book readers are portable.

questions.text: True or False: An e-book reader is a type of embedded computer.
questions.explanation: An e-book reader is a dedicated device for reading digital books, not an embedded computer.

questions.text: Which of the following is a type of specialized computer used for point-of-sale transactions?
questions.explanation: POS terminals are specialized computers used in retail stores for managing sales transactions.

questions.text: Which of the following devices is typically used in banks for cash withdrawals and deposits?
questions.explanation: ATMs are specialized terminals used in banks to allow customers to perform financial transactions.

questions.text: Which device is often used for reading electronic books and periodicals?
questions.explanation: E-book readers are designed specifically for reading digital books and periodicals.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of a server?
options: A. Provides resources to other computers
C. Offers file storage and management
questions.explanation: Servers do not display webpages; they host and serve them to clients.

questions.text: True or False: A tablet is considered a mobile device because it is lightweight and portable.
questions.explanation: Tablets are mobile devices due to their lightweight design and portability.

questions.text: What type of device is often embedded in appliances and cars to perform dedicated functions?
questions.explanation: Embedded computers are used in appliances, cars, and other devices to perform dedicated functions.

questions.text: Which of the following is a major benefit of using cloud computing?
options: C. Access to files from anywhere
questions.correctAnswer: C. Access to files from anywhere
questions.explanation: Cloud computing allows users to access files and applications from any location with an internet connection.

questions.text: True or False: Desktops are more portable than laptops.
questions.explanation: Desktops are stationary and less portable compared to laptops.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a special-purpose computer?
questions.explanation: Laptops are general-purpose computers, while POS terminals, ATMs, and game consoles are special-purpose.

questions.text: Which of the following health issues is commonly associated with prolonged computer use?
questions.explanation: Prolonged computer use can lead to eyestrain due to staring at screens for extended periods.

questions.text: Which of the following is an ergonomic principle for setting up a workspace?
options: A. Keep the monitor at eye level
C. Place keyboard above shoulder height
D. Sit on a high stool
questions.correctAnswer: A. Keep the monitor at eye level
questions.explanation: An ergonomic workspace should have the monitor at eye level to reduce neck strain.

questions.text: Which type of computing device is designed to be highly portable and lightweight?
questions.explanation: Laptops are designed for portability, making them lightweight and easy to carry.

questions.text: Which of the following is used to secure a laptop and prevent theft?
questions.explanation: Cable locks are used to secure laptops to a stationary object to prevent theft.

questions.text: True or False: An all-in-one desktop has a separate tower component.
questions.explanation: All-in-one desktops integrate all components into a single unit, without a separate tower.

questions.text: Which of the following is a handheld computing device that is small enough to fit in one hand?
questions.explanation: Stick computers are small computing devices that are typically the size of a USB flash drive.

questions.text: Which type of computer is best suited for running high-performance applications and storing large amounts of data?
questions.explanation: Servers are designed for high-performance applications and large data storage needs.

questions.text: What type of input device is used to capture images or video?
questions.explanation: Digital cameras are used to capture images and videos.

questions.text: True or False: Cloud storage is a form of local storage.
questions.explanation: Cloud storage is remote storage accessed over the internet, not local storage.

questions.text: Which of the following devices is NOT a portable computing device?
questions.explanation: Desktops are stationary and not considered portable computing devices.

questions.text: What is the primary function of an ATM?
questions.explanation: ATMs are used by customers to perform various banking transactions.

questions.text: Which of the following is a dedicated device used for playing digital media such as music and videos?
questions.explanation: Portable media players are used for playing digital media like music and videos.

questions.text: Which type of computer is designed for use in a stationary location?
questions.explanation: Desktops are designed for use in a fixed location and are not portable.

questions.text: True or False: A gaming console is an example of a special-purpose computer.
questions.explanation: Game consoles are designed specifically for gaming and are considered special-purpose computers.

questions.text: Which of the following devices is typically used for printing text and graphics on paper?
questions.explanation: Printers are used to produce text and graphics on physical media like paper.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a surge protector?
options: A. To protect against power surges
questions.correctAnswer: A. To protect against power surges
questions.explanation: Surge protectors help safeguard electronic devices from power surges.

questions.text: True or False: Digital cameras can only capture still images.
questions.explanation: Digital cameras can capture both still images and videos.
